result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A. Jones was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Nicholas A. Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Comply with Veteran's Court & complete Veteran's Court.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A. Jones

records.addlTxt: Terminated on 4/15/17

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Case remanded back to this court for imposition of sentence in order for the deft to be accepted into Veteran's Court.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.
Defense counsel out ill - sentencing hrg adj to 10/15/15 @ 3pm; Email sent to attys
Sentencing hearing at 10-12-2015 03:15 pm
9/1/15 no hearing in Racine Co.; Veteran's court starts after sentencing. Referred back to Br.3 for scheduling.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Atty Lassiter reports the case is resolved.  Deft has been accepted into Veteran's Court.  Hold open agreement is w/drawn.  Count 2 is orally amended to strike the DOB and to include the language of "failure of consent."  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Deft is scheduled for sentencing in Veteran's Court on 9/1/15 @ 3:30pm in Racine County; change of venue is granted.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.
amended info
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  Brief discussion held.  Court unwillingly to take the plea based on the representation that it would require the court place to place the deft on probation on counts 2 & 3.  Court believes this is unlawful.  Status set for 8/28/15 @ 10:30am to check on whether the case has been transferred to Veteran's Court for plea/sentencing
FPT rescheduled to 7/24/15 at 9:30 AM per confirmation with Atty Lassiter and she will providing notice to the defendant.
Court reviewed email correspondence from Atty Lassiter and FPT to be rescheduled.
Email correspondence received from Atty Lassiter stating she is out sick today.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Atty Lassiter reports the necessary docs for Veterans Court were just forwarded to the proper personnel last week.  Per Court, set case for FPT/JS dates.  There will be no further adjournments.  FPT 6/26/15 @ 11:15am, JS 8/3/15 @ 9am.  NOTE - trial date set for 8/3/15 since Atty Lassiter is not available for trial on 7/13/15

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rufo (on behalf of Atty Lassiter).  Parties request another adjournment to see if deft can get into Veteran's Court.  Status set for 5/18/15 @ 1:45pm

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  CHIPS case has been resolved.  Case reset for status conf. on 4/30/15 at 10:15, to allow time to see if def. qualifies for Veteran's Court.  JS on 4/27/15 is removed from the calendar.  Bond continued.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-19-15 @ 1:40pm. Jury selection on 4-27-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Carmen Lassiter

1:16pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter. Clerk:LErvin.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set for 01-09-2015 at 9:15am. $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
